sentences: Jared Drake Bell (born June 27, 1986), also known as Drake Campana, is an American actor, singer, songwriter, and musician.

== Philanthropy ==

sentences: Philanthropy ==
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Since 2009, Bell has supported the Thirst Project, a non-profit organization that addresses the issue of the clean water crisis by raising awareness through education.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Bell's contributions include public appeals and concerts to raise funds.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Seth Maxwell, founder of the Thirst Project, recruited Bell to be the 'face' of the campaign.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Bell has also made contributions to other organizations such as Toys for Tots.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: On April 18, 2015, Bell performed at the Strawberry Bowl in support of the charity Rockin A Cure for cystic fibrosis.
section: == Philanthropy ==
== Influences ==

sentences: Influences ==
section: == Influences ==

sentences: Bell has described his music as being heavily influenced by the Beatles, The Beach Boys, and Brian Setzer.
section: == Influences ==

sentences: Among other music acts and artists that have influenced Bell are Oasis, Buddy Holly, Elvis Costello, The Rolling Stones, Led Zeppelin, Jimmy Page, Eddie Cochran, Elvis Presley, and Chuck Berry.
section: == Influences ==

sentences: Since 2021, Bell has become a micro-influencer in the digital NFT market, collaborating with artist Gus Fink on sales of Numb Bunny NFT.
section: == Influences ==

sentences: The online community affectionately refers to him as "El Frijolito" for his passion for the community and work to grow its platform.
section: == Influences ==
== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: On December 29, 2005, Bell, then 19 years old, and a friend of his were driving from Malibu to Los Angeles when, while stopped at a red light on California State Route 1, the two were struck by an oncoming vehicle.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Though Bell's passenger suffered only bruises, Bell's injuries, while not life-threatening, were severe, including a fractured neck and vertebra, a broken jaw, the loss of seven teeth, and deep lacerations to his face.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: As part of his recovery, Bell required more than 70 facial stitches, had to have his jaw wired shut for two months, and underwent surgery on his chin and mouth.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2007, Bell purchased a 2,640-square-foot (245 m2) house in Los Feliz for $2,050,000.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: After Bell filed for bankruptcy in California in early 2014, the house was taken in foreclosure.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Bell is a cousin of former San Diego Padres relief pitcher Heath Bell.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In August 2020, his former girlfriend Melissa Lingafelt accused him of verbal and physical abuse during their three-year relationship in the late 2000s.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Bell has denied the allegations.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In July 2021, Bell revealed that he has been married since 2018 and has a son.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Bell was arrested on December 21, 2015, for driving under the influence in Glendale, California at 2:45 AM after police officers witnessed him swerving and driving well over the speed limit.
section: == Legal issues == | === Driving under the influence ===

sentences: He was subsequently released on $20,000 bond and pleaded not guilty.
section: == Legal issues == | === Driving under the influence ===

sentences: In September 2016, Bell pleaded guilty and was sentenced to four days in jail and four years' probation and would be required to attend an alcohol education program; Bell served only one day for good behavior.
section: == Legal issues == | === Driving under the influence ===

sentences: Bell was previously charged with driving under the influence in 2010 in relation to an incident in San Diego in 2009.

sentences: On June 4, 2021, Bell was arrested in Cleveland, Ohio, on charges relating to "attempted endangering [of] children and disseminating matter harmful to juveniles."
section: == Legal issues == | === Sexual assault accusation and attempted endangering of children ===

sentences: A public information officer with the Cuyahoga County Prosecutor's Office, said "the 15-year-old victim, who had established a relationship with Bell several years prior, attended his concert in December 2017
section: == Legal issues == | === Sexual assault accusation and attempted endangering of children ===

sentences: While there, Bell violated his duty of care and, in doing so, created a risk of harm to the victim."
section: == Legal issues == | === Sexual assault accusation and attempted endangering of children ===

sentences: The Cleveland Police also found that Bell had sent the minor "inappropriate social media messages" for "months leading up to the concert."

sentences: Bell was 31 at the time of the alleged incident.
section: == Legal issues == | === Sexual assault accusation and attempted endangering of children ===

sentences: Bell pleaded not guilty, and was freed on a $2,500 personal bond, and was ordered to provide a DNA sample.

sentences: He agreed to have no contact with the accuser in the case with a pretrial hearing scheduled for June 23.
section: == Legal issues == | === Sexual assault accusation and attempted endangering of children ===

sentences: On June 23, Bell pleaded guilty to both charges.
section: == Legal issues == | === Sexual assault accusation and attempted endangering of children ===

sentences: On July 12, 2021, Bell's accuser, now 19, made a public appearance and statement accusing him of sexually assaulting her while she was underage, in addition to the endangerment charges.
section: == Legal issues == | === Sexual assault accusation and attempted endangering of children ===

sentences: Bell was sentenced to two years of probation and 200 hours of community service (which he may complete in California).

sentences: Bell was nominated for a Young Artist Award twice, once in 2000 for his role in The Jack Bull, in which he won, and another time in 2006 for Yours, Mine and Ours.
section: == Awards and nominations ==

sentences: He has won 10 Kids Choice Awards, 3 in the United States and 5 internationally for his role as Drake Parker on Drake & Josh.
section: == Awards and nominations ==

sentences: He also won a Kids Choice Award in 2007 in the United Kingdom for Best Male Singer, winning over Justin Timberlake.
section: == Awards and nominations ==

sentences: He was also nominated for Best TV Actor, but lost to Nat Wolff.
section: == Awards and nominations ==

sentences: Bell has also won a Teen Choice Award in 2008 for his role as the Dragonfly in Superhero Movie.
section: == Awards and nominations ==

sentences: He was also nominated for an award in 2014 in the Capital Twitter Awards for biggest Twitter feud with Justin Bieber.
